intro: Borreria felis-insulae, commonly known as the island hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Caribbean and Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Borreria felis-insulae thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates.
